title: Exam Invoice Good Standing Gate
statement: The system shall prevent the generation of an exam invoice unless the auditor status is 'In Good Standing'.
rationale: Ensures only eligible auditors can proceed with exam purchasing.

title: Exam Invoice Financial Gate
statement: The system shall prevent the generation of an exam invoice if the auditor has any unpaid fee invoices or pending exam invoices.
rationale: Ensures auditors settle outstanding obligations before purchasing new exams.

title: Sequential Exam Progression
statement: The system shall enforce sequential exam progression: Part 1 must be passed before Part 2; Part 2 must be passed before Part 3.
rationale: Maintains the integrity of the certification pathway.

title: Part 3 Audit Log Prerequisite
statement: The system shall require an approved Audit Log (minimum 20 days experience) before generating a Part 3 exam invoice.
rationale: Part 3 exam requires practical auditing experience as a prerequisite.

title: Part 1/2 No Audit Log Required
statement: The system shall allow Part 1 and Part 2 invoices to be generated without an approved Audit Log.
rationale: Part 1 and Part 2 exams do not require practical experience.

title: Exam Invoice Auto-Expiration
statement: The system shall automatically expire exam invoices that have not been scheduled within the validity period defined in the Fee Schedule.
rationale: Prevents indefinite holding of exam purchases and maintains scheduling throughput.

title: Language Preference Capture
statement: The system shall capture the auditor's language preference at the time of invoice generation to ensure the correct exam type is scheduled.
rationale: Ensures exam delivery in the auditor's preferred language.

title: Bulk Auditor Selection
statement: The system shall allow authorized firm contacts to select multiple associated auditors for batch exam purchasing.
rationale: Enables efficient bulk purchasing workflow for firms managing multiple auditors.

title: Individual Eligibility Validation
statement: The system shall validate each auditor's eligibility individually before including them in a bulk invoice.
rationale: Ensures only eligible auditors are included in bulk purchases.

title: Consolidated Bulk Invoice
statement: The system shall generate a single consolidated invoice for all eligible auditors in a bulk purchase.
rationale: Simplifies billing for firms purchasing multiple exams.

title: Firm Payer Tracking
statement: The system shall record the 'paid by firm' status on each exam line item for use in downstream fee logic.
rationale: Enables proper fee handling when firm pays for exam.

title: Ineligible Auditor Exclusion
statement: The system shall prevent inclusion of auditors who do not meet eligibility requirements in the bulk purchase.
rationale: Maintains data integrity by excluding ineligible auditors from bulk orders.

title: Schedule Button Payment Gate
statement: The system shall display a 'Schedule' button only on paid exam invoices.
rationale: Prevents scheduling until payment is confirmed.

title: ProctorU Slot Retrieval
statement: The system shall retrieve available exam slots via the ProctorU API based on the exam type and language selected (Part 1 and 2).
rationale: Enables real-time availability display from proctoring provider.

title: Part 3 Calendly Interface
statement: The system shall display the APSCA Calendly interface filtered by language to secure an interviewer slot (Part 3).
rationale: Part 3 requires interviewer coordination via Calendly before ProctorU booking.

title: Part 3 ProctorU Auto-Reservation
statement: The system shall create a ProctorU reservation via API immediately upon confirmation of a Calendly slot for Part 3 exams.
rationale: Ensures proctoring is synchronized with interviewer availability.

title: ProctorU Account Sync
statement: The system shall create or update the test-taker's ProctorU account using their APSCA Member Number as the unique identifier to prevent duplicate accounts.
rationale: Maintains account integrity across APSCA and ProctorU systems.

title: Exam Metadata Population
statement: The system shall populate exam metadata (notes, permitted resources) sent to ProctorU based on the Exam Template for the specific exam type and language.
rationale: Ensures proctors have correct instructions for each exam variant.

title: Time Zone Mapping
statement: The system shall map the auditor's selected time zone to the closest valid ProctorU time zone ID per the Time Zone Mapping artifact.
rationale: Ensures accurate scheduling across different time zone systems.

title: Lead Time Enforcement
statement: The system shall enforce minimum lead times for scheduling as defined in the Exam Scheduling Rules artifact.
rationale: Ensures adequate preparation time and resource availability.

title: Platform-Only Scheduling
statement: The system shall mandate that all exam scheduling originate from the APSCA platform to ensure data synchronization.
rationale: Maintains APSCA as the single source of truth for exam scheduling.

title: Reschedule/Cancel Buttons
statement: The system shall display 'Reschedule' and 'Cancel' buttons for scheduled exams.
rationale: Enables self-service exam management for auditors.

title: Time-Based Fee Application
statement: The system shall apply fees for cancellations and reschedules based on the time windows defined in the Fee Schedule.
rationale: Enforces fee structure based on proximity to exam date.

title: Firm-Paid Fee Payer Selection
statement: The system shall require the user to select the payer (Auditor or Firm) for cancellation/reschedule fees if the original invoice was paid by a firm.
rationale: Enables proper fee attribution when firm funded the original exam.

title: No-Change Window Enforcement
statement: The system shall prevent rescheduling within the 'No Change' window defined in the Fee Schedule; such requests must be processed as cancellations requiring a new invoice.
rationale: Enforces scheduling freeze period before exam date.

title: Reschedule Limit Enforcement
statement: The system shall disable the reschedule button if the auditor has exceeded the maximum reschedule attempts defined in the Fee Schedule.
rationale: Prevents excessive rescheduling that impacts resource planning.

title: Invoice Re-Availability
statement: The system shall remove the exam date from the invoice line item upon cancellation (outside the no-refund window), making the invoice available for re-booking.
rationale: Allows reuse of paid invoice for future scheduling when eligible.

title: Outstanding Fees Scheduling Block
statement: The system shall block scheduling or rescheduling until outstanding fee invoices are paid.
rationale: Ensures financial obligations are settled before new scheduling.

title: Firm Change Request Submission
statement: The system shall allow authorized firm contacts to submit exam change requests for exams funded by the firm.
rationale: Enables firms to manage exams they funded on behalf of auditors.

title: Change Request Types
statement: The system shall support change request types including: cancellation, reschedule, credit transfer, and fee dispute.
rationale: Covers the range of changes firms may need to request.

title: Change Request Status Tracking
statement: The system shall track change request status (Submitted, Under Review, Approved, Denied).
rationale: Provides visibility into request processing stages.

title: Change Request Notifications
statement: The system shall notify the firm contact of change request status updates.
rationale: Keeps firms informed of request progress.

title: Credit Transfer Between Auditors
statement: The system shall allow transfer of exam credits between auditors within the same firm upon approval.
rationale: Enables firms to reassign exam credits within their organization.

title: Change Request Audit Trail
statement: The system shall maintain an audit trail of all change request actions and decisions.
rationale: Provides accountability and traceability for change management.

title: Start Exam Button Availability
statement: The system shall display a 'Start Exam' button on the auditor's dashboard within the pre-exam window defined in the Exam Scheduling Rules.
rationale: Enables exam launch during the designated window.

title: ProctorU Auto-Auth Link
statement: The system shall generate the 'Start Exam' link via the ProctorU API that auto-authenticates the user into their proctoring session.
rationale: Provides seamless launch experience without manual ProctorU login.

title: Backup Launch URL Email
statement: The system shall send a confirmation email upon scheduling that includes a backup launch URL.
rationale: Provides fallback access if primary launch mechanism fails.

title: Exam In Progress Status
statement: The system shall update the exam status to 'In Progress' when the auditor launches the exam.
rationale: Tracks exam lifecycle state for monitoring and reporting.

title: ProctorU Webhook Processing
statement: The system shall receive and process webhooks from ProctorU for exam completion events.
rationale: Enables automated status updates from proctoring provider.

title: ProctorU Status Mapping
statement: The system shall map ProctorU webhook statuses to APSCA exam statuses per the ProctorU Status Mapping artifact.
rationale: Translates external status codes to internal exam states.

title: Results Pending Status
statement: The system shall update the exam status to 'Results Pending' upon receiving a 'Fulfillment Ended' webhook.
rationale: Indicates exam completion awaiting score entry.

title: Manual Score Entry
statement: The system shall allow administrators to manually input numerical scores and Pass/Fail results.
rationale: Enables official result recording by authorized personnel.

title: Exam Completed Status
statement: The system shall update the exam status to 'Completed' once a Pass/Fail result is recorded.
rationale: Marks exam as fully processed with final result.

title: No-Show Penalty Application
statement: The system shall handle 'No Show' statuses by applying penalties as defined in the Fee Schedule.
rationale: Enforces consequences for missed exam appointments.

title: IT Issue Rebooking
statement: The system shall handle 'IT Issue' statuses by allowing rebooking without penalty.
rationale: Enables recovery from technical failures outside auditor control.

title: Audit Log Status Snapshot
statement: The system shall capture a snapshot of the auditor's Audit Log status at the moment an exam is marked completed.
rationale: Preserves point-in-time state for compliance verification.

title: Part 3 Failure Count Tracking
statement: The system shall track cumulative Part 3 exam failure count per auditor.
rationale: Enables enforcement of remediation policies based on failure history.

title: Waiting Period Trigger
statement: The system shall place an auditor into 'Part 3 Waiting Period' status upon reaching the failure threshold defined in the Remediation Policy.
rationale: Enforces mandatory pause before next exam attempt.

title: Training Requirement (3-5 Failures)
statement: The system shall require auditors in the 3-5 failure range to submit a training record before restoration.
rationale: Mandates additional preparation for repeated failures.

title: Auto Eligibility Restoration
statement: The system shall restore exam eligibility via automated job once the waiting period has elapsed and training is approved (3-5 failures).
rationale: Automates restoration after remediation compliance.

title: Audit Log Redo (6+ Failures)
statement: The system shall require auditors with 6+ failures to complete a new 20-day Audit Log before exam eligibility is restored.
rationale: Mandates substantial re-qualification for chronic failures.

title: Training Block for 6+ Failures
statement: The system shall prevent training submissions for auditors with 6+ failures, displaying the audit log requirement instead.
rationale: Enforces correct remediation path based on failure count.

title: Restoration Notification
statement: The system shall send eligibility restoration notifications upon successful completion of remediation requirements.
rationale: Informs auditors when they can resume exam scheduling.

title: Exam Template Database
statement: The system shall maintain a database of Exam Templates for each exam type and language combination.
rationale: Centralizes exam configuration for consistent API payloads.

title: Exam Metadata Storage
statement: The system shall store exam metadata including: duration, permitted resources, proctor instructions, and exam platform credentials.
rationale: Captures all data needed for ProctorU API integration.

title: Exam Template Management
statement: The system shall allow administrators to create, update, and deprecate Exam Templates.
rationale: Enables maintenance of exam configuration data.

title: Active Template Usage
statement: The system shall use the active Exam Template when constructing ProctorU API payloads during scheduling.
rationale: Ensures current configuration is applied to new reservations.

title: Admin Exam Search
statement: The system shall provide administrators with a searchable view of all exam records.
rationale: Enables efficient lookup of exam information for support.

title: Admin Proxy Scheduling
statement: The system shall allow administrators to schedule exams on behalf of auditors.
rationale: Enables administrative assistance for scheduling issues.

title: Admin Fee/Timing Override
statement: The system shall allow administrators to reschedule or cancel exams without standard fee or timing restrictions.
rationale: Enables administrative exceptions for special circumstances.

title: Admin Eligibility Override
statement: The system shall allow administrators to override eligibility rules when scheduling (with audit trail).
rationale: Enables handling of edge cases with proper documentation.

title: Override Reason Required
statement: The system shall require administrators to provide a reason when overriding standard rules.
rationale: Ensures accountability for administrative exceptions.

title: Admin Action Logging
statement: The system shall log all administrative exam actions with timestamp, user, and reason.
rationale: Provides complete audit trail for administrative operations.
